crash.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to have an accident in a car, plane etc by violently hitting something else
crash.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: He was drunk when he crashed the car.
The plane crashed into a mountain.
crash.translation[0].definitions[0].note: Crash is a reciprocal verb This type of verb is used when saying that two or more people or things do something that involves both or all of them
Two planes crashed with each other in midair
One plane crashed with another in midair
crash.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to hit something or someone extremely hard while moving, in a way that causes a lot of damage or makes a lot of noise
crash.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The plates went crashing to the ground.
A large branch came crashing down.
A brick crashed through the window.
We watched the waves crashing against the rocks.
crash.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to make a sudden loud noise
crash.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: if a computer crashes, or if you crash the computer, it suddenly stops working
crash.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: The system crashed and I lost three hours’ worth of work.
crash.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: if a stock market or shares crash, they suddenly lose a lot of value
crash.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: to lose very badly in a sports event
crash.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: Liverpool crashed to their worst defeat of the season.
crash.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: to stay at someone’s house for the night
crash.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: Can I crash at your place on Saturday night?
crash.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: to go to bed, or go to sleep very quickly, because you are very tired
crash.translation[0].definitions[7].exam: I crashed out on the sofa this afternoon.
crash.translation[0].definitions[8].defi: to go to a party that you have not been invited to
crash.translation[0].note_box[0].section: crash
to hit another vehicle, a tree, the ground etc, with a lot of force, causing a lot of damage
The plane crashed a kilometre from the runway.
He was scared I’d crash his car.
The car crashed into a tree.
to move into something quickly and with force
He wasn’t paying attention, and almost hit another car.
The car hit a lamppost.
collide
if two cars, trains, planes etc collide, they hit each other, especially when they are moving in opposite directions
The two planes collided in mid-air.
An express train collided with a freight train in the morning rush hour.
run into something
to hit a vehicle or object that is directly in front of you, especially because you are not paying attention
He ran into the car in front while he was talking on his mobile phone.
smash into something
to crash into something, causing a great amount of damage
An army helicopter smashed into the side of the mountain.
plough into
to crash into something with a lot of force, especially when your vehicle continues moving afterwards
The bus went out of control and ploughed into a line of traffic.
ram
to deliberately hit another boat or vehicle very hard, especially when it is not moving
The ship had been rammed by a submarine.
The gunmen tried to ram the police car.
crash.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: an accident in which a vehicle violently hits something else
crash.translation[1].definitions[0].note: a fatal crash (=one in which someone is killed)
crash.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Forty-one people were killed in a plane crash.
She was involved in a head-on crash with a motorbike  (=in which the front of one vehicle directly hits the front of another).
a motorway crash between a coach and a lorry
crash.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a sudden loud noise made by something falling, breaking etc
crash.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The branch came down with a crash.
crash.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: an occasion when a computer or computer system suddenly stops working
crash.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: an occasion on which the stocks and shares in a stock market suddenly lose a lot of value
crash.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: the stock market crash of October 1987
crash.translation[1].note_box[0].section: He was badly hurt in a car crash.
There will be an investigation into the cause of the air crash.
He died in a head-on crash with a lorry.
There have been several fatal crashes on this road.
the risk of injury from a high-speed crash
a horrific crash in which three teenage boys were killed
I’ve been nervous about driving since I had a crash last year.
The three-vehicle crash happened on the corner of Ongar Road.
Two women were taken to hospital after a crash involving a bus and a car.
Families of the crash victims want to know what happened.
The authorities closed off a five-mile area around the crash site.
Crash investigators spent several days examining the scene.
crash.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a time when many stocks and shares lose a lot of their value very quickly, usually when investors lose confidence in the market and want to sell quickly
crash.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: the stock market crash of October 1987
crash.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: an occasion when a computer or a piece of computer software suddenly stops working
crash.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: If you don’t save your work and there’s a crash, you’ll lose everything you’ve done.
crash.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: if stockmarkets or shares crash, they suddenly lose a lot of value
crash.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The cost of the project has soared, causing the shares to crash 11p to 329p.
crash.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: if a computer or a piece of software crashes, or if you crash it, it suddenly stops working properly
crash.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: The memory was completely overloaded, causing the system to crash.
an error which crashed the whole system
